articles.content: Shares of Tata Consumer Products jumped 3% to Rs 866.2 in Monday's trade on BSE after the Global brokerage firm Citi initiated a 'Buy' call on the stock with a target price of Rs 1,020, which indicat… [+1963 chars]

articles.title: Sanjiv Puri on 4 pillars that can take ITC to the next level of growth - Economic Times
articles.description: ​Digital is now mainstreamed in our companies. It is part of everybody's job whether it is agri sourcing or procurement or operation, manufacturing, consumer marketing, commerce, everywhere it is there.
articles.content: "So, organisations necessarily need to be very nimble, agile and consumer-centric because this poses challenges and also any change is also an opportunity," says Sanjiv Puri, CMD, ITC.What would be I… [+2804 chars]

articles.title: Grasim Industries' board approves debt plans, shares fall - Moneycontrol
articles.description: Having started as a textile manufacturer, Grasim has forayed into varied businesses such as viscose, diversified chemicals, linen yarn and fabrics producer in India.
articles.content: The issuance of non-convertible debentures (NCD) on a private placement basis, totaling a maximum of Rs 2,000 crore, in one or multiple installments, was approved by the Board of Directors of Grasim … [+2231 chars]

articles.title: SBI Card Downgraded By Nomura As It Continues To Lose Market Share - BQ Prime
articles.description: The brokerage cut the target price on the stock from Rs 1,030 to Rs 700, implying a downside of about 18.32%.
articles.content:
Nomura Holdings Inc. has downgraded SBI Cards and Payment Services Ltd. to 'reduce' as the company continues to lose market share.

articles.description: Foxconn, the contract manufacturing firm, is actively seeking new partners for its semiconductor business in India as its joint venture with Vedanta Group encounters obstacles
